questions.question: When Riya saw the surprise test paper, she was ___.
questions.explanation: 'In hot water' means in trouble or difficulty. Seeing a surprise test would make someone worried, not happy. 'Over the moon' means extremely happy.

questions.question: Don't tell him the secret – he always ___.
options: lets the cat out of the bag
hits the nail on the head
questions.answer: lets the cat out of the bag
questions.explanation: 'Lets the cat out of the bag' means to reveal a secret accidentally. 'Hits the nail on the head' means to be exactly right about something.

questions.question: After losing the match, the team decided to ___.
questions.explanation: 'Call it a day' means to stop working/trying for now. After losing, the team decided to stop and rest.

questions.question: My brother is very lazy; he always ___.
questions.explanation: 'Passes the buck' means to shift responsibility to someone else, which lazy people often do. 'Beats around the bush' means to avoid talking directly about something.

questions.question: The teacher asked us to ___ the new student.
questions.explanation: 'Keep an eye on' means to watch carefully or look after someone. 'Spill the beans' means to reveal secret information.

questions.question: She was ___ when she heard about her promotion.
questions.explanation: 'Over the moon' means extremely happy or delighted. A promotion is good news that would make someone very happy. 'Under the weather' means feeling ill.

questions.question: Stop ___ and tell me what really happened!
questions.explanation: 'Beating around the bush' means avoiding the main topic or not speaking directly. 'Breaking the ice' means to start a conversation in a social situation.

questions.question: The exam was a ___; everyone passed easily.
questions.explanation: 'Piece of cake' means something very easy. 'Hard nut to crack' means something difficult to understand or deal with.

questions.question: You need to ___ and apologize for your mistake.
questions.explanation: 'Face the music' means to accept the consequences of your actions. 'Call it a day' means to stop working.

questions.question: The new project costs an ___ because of all the expensive materials.
questions.explanation: 'Costs an arm and a leg' means very expensive. 'Apple of my eye' refers to someone you love very much.

questions.question: I'm feeling a bit ___ today, so I'll stay home and rest.
questions.explanation: 'Under the weather' means feeling ill or unwell. 'On cloud nine' means extremely happy.

questions.question: Learning to drive is not difficult; you'll get the ___ soon.
questions.explanation: 'Get the hang of it' means to learn how to do something. 'Get the ball rolling' means to start something.

questions.question: Don't worry about what others say; just take it with a ___.
questions.explanation: 'Take it with a grain of salt' means to not take something too seriously or literally. 'Piece of mind' is incorrect (the idiom is 'peace of mind').

questions.question: The two companies decided to ___ and work together.
questions.explanation: 'Bury the hatchet' means to make peace and end a disagreement. 'Bite the bullet' means to endure something painful.

questions.question: She ___ when she saw the spider on the wall.
questions.explanation: 'Jumped out of her skin' means to be extremely startled or frightened. 'Kept her cool' means to stay calm.

questions.question: My grandmother is the ___ – I love her more than anyone.
questions.explanation: 'Apple of my eye' refers to a person you love very much. 'Black sheep' refers to someone who is different or troublesome in a family.

questions.question: Let's ___ and start the discussion.
questions.explanation: 'Break the ice' means to initiate conversation or make people feel comfortable. 'Rock the boat' means to cause trouble or disturb a stable situation.

questions.question: He's been burning the ___ studying for exams.
questions.explanation: 'Burning the midnight oil' means working or studying late into the night. 'Burning bridges' means destroying relationships.

questions.question: The math problem was a ___ – even the teacher couldn't solve it!
questions.explanation: 'Hard nut to crack' means something very difficult to understand or solve. 'Piece of cake' means something easy.

questions.question: You should ___ and accept this job offer before it's too late.
questions.explanation: 'Bite the bullet' means to face a difficult situation with courage. 'Cry over spilt milk' means to regret something that cannot be changed.
